metadata.synopsis: Section of the Astarion's In Party dialog where we discuss the aftermath of the Black Mass Ritual (Astarion became vampire lord or stayed vampire spawn, possible romance/friendship discussions)

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: You are so beautiful... And you will be beautiful forever. Thank you for trusting me.
7.context: InternalNodeContext: Lord Astarion converted the player into a spawn this night. Morning CRD. Jumps to the discussion of Astarion's powers. If skipped, we unlock it till discussed, but without the exclamation mark.

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: You were drained dry, and at the height of your delirium, I granted you one drop of my own blood.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I'm already a Slayer and a squid - this is minor in comparison.

116.speaker: Astarion
116.text: Terrifying and brilliant. I knew you'd take it in your stride.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I already turned into a spiny Bhaalbeast, this isn't a big deal.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I'm already part-squid - this isn't a big deal.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Well, I suppose it cannot be undone now.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: You are stronger now. Better. You will thank me one day, I am sure.

196.speaker: Astarion
196.text: Things will be a touch different for you than they were for me when I was a spawn.

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: I'm imbibed with unfathomable new talents. I am fairly certain I can extend Mephistopheles' blessings unto you.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Does that mean I need not fear the sun?

159.speaker: Astarion
159.text: You will be stronger, swifter, sharper, but you won't be different. You were already perfect before. It's hard to improve.

137.speaker: Astarion
137.text: You probably expect me to turn into a sea of mist, run wrongside-up on roofs, and to call on legions of wolves in battle.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Ironic to become immortal, when we could die any day.

179.speaker: Astarion
179.text: I don't intend to die, if you don't. I truly believe we can best the brain, united like this.

177.speaker: Astarion
177.text: Exactly what symptoms of vampirism are going to manifest in you... well, we'll have to see what hand the tadpole has in suppressing them, when we wrangle it under our command.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: You are so beautiful... And you will be beautiful forever. Thank you for trusting me.
83.context: InternalNodeContext: Lord Astarion converted the player into a spawn this night. Fallback in case the player skipped the CRD node above.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: *Sigh.* There's no use in us fighting any longer, is there?
84.context: InternalNodeContext: Two days after we broke up with Astarion Lord during the Black Mass Aftermath Romance night he wants to discuss it with us.

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: You are a person of rare talent. You aided greatly in my conquest, even if you did not end up a part of it.

172.speaker: Astarion
172.text: And if we were beholden to one another? Well, how is that too different to being enslaved? It is for the best.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: You were terrible for me. And I did terrible things for you.

215.speaker: Astarion
215.text: The man of your dreams, the hope of him, is your own worst enemy.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Love is very different, but I don't think you'll ever understand.

241.speaker: Astarion
241.text: Of course I understand love. All too well.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: I don't believe this is sincere.

197.speaker: Astarion
197.text: I was trying, with you, you know. In the only way I can try.

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: The gravest crimes committed in this world are committed for love. A hunger crueller than bloodlust.

199.speaker: Astarion
199.text: I know how to play with it, and can't resist playing the hand I know. I would have ruined your love, used your trust until you were nothing.

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: So, for what it's worth. In the end I respect you for making the choice you did. I never thought you had it in you.

143.speaker: Astarion
143.text: I hope if not partners, we may be partners in crime yet.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: I think this has all worked out for the best, hasn't it?

130.speaker: Astarion
130.text: Not a skill that has cropped up in my newly-found repertoire. I probably need to read some tome to figure out how.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: You've tried to trick me too many times. I can't trust you again.

185.speaker: Astarion
185.text: At least until the brain is defeated, you have my word I'll stand by you. We share a common cause. There will be no more bites in the night.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I don't want to see you again, when this is over.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: So it shall be. Never again.

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: But I will ensure our little mission to defeat the brain succeeds. You can count on me for that.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: It feels ridiculous to still be thinking about Cazador. He's gone, I'm here - I won.
107.context: InternalNodeContext: BlackMass Aftermath Romance night with Spawn Astarion ended, this branch is enabled till discussed

114.speaker: Astarion
114.text: But I still keep reliving everything that happened. Playing it over and over in my mind.

117.speaker: Astarion
117.text: This is it. The hopeless dream dreamt by all of my kind.
117.context: InternalNodeContext: Astarion just became the Vampire Lord. Immediate follow up in the Ritual Room with IPRD.

218.speaker: Astarion
218.text: I am the greatest vampire to ever walk this land. Even the Pale Knight would have knelt before me.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: I felt so very little for so long... My edges dulled over the numb years rotting in the boudoir and kennels.

206.speaker: Astarion
206.text: Now, I can hear it at last. See it at last. How all the lowly creatures of this plane are begging to serve. How to call upon them.

214.speaker: Astarion
214.text: Scurrying footpads in their safe-houses, rats below our feet in their filthy holes, the crows in the night above... They will obey.

221.speaker: Astarion
221.text: In you, too, I can tell... your heartbeat races... you hold your breath while I speak. You await my command.

150.speaker: Astarion
150.text: The world will stir in fear.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Yes - embrace it. Show Faerûn your power.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Embrace it. Together this world will be ours.

208.speaker: Astarion
208.text: I already hear the world whispering in sweet surrender.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Appreciate this power. So many of your kind perished for you.

186.speaker: Astarion
186.text: The spawn? It won't take long to get a new army. I'll make new ones soon.

210.speaker: Astarion
210.text: You've been very brave, haven't you? You've done so much for me...

176.speaker: Astarion
176.text: Our lives will never be the same again.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Come on, you're still the same Astarion, just stronger.

178.speaker: Astarion
178.text: Oh, I wouldn't be so sure. The very composition of my blood has been altered...

138.speaker: Player
138.text: You may have power, but your greatness is yet to be proven.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: Ssh. Hush. Feel what is in the air.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: No more Cazador, isn't it a relief?

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Never again. I will not think about him. I don't want to even say his name.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I suppose it can be left to the past.

126.speaker: Astarion
126.text: You probably expect me to turn into a sea of mist, run wrongside-up on roofs, and to call on legions of wolves in battle.
126.context: InternalNodeContext: We discuss Astarion becoming the Lord. Non-romance option. Morning CRD, available the next morning after Astarion deciding to stay a spawn.

156.speaker: Astarion
156.text: That will all happen in due time. But for now, patience is required. I hear the whispers of the night, but I can't yet speak its language.

239.speaker: Astarion
239.text: It's going to take a while to become acquainted with my new self.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: You have seemed distant since the ritual.

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: Have I? It's possible. I think my instincts have become so quick that the world around me can't catch up.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: Everything is moving at a grinding pace. I feel like I will live thousands of hours every day.

153.speaker: Astarion
153.text: Everything lies ahead. I can see my path to a waking dream.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: From the crimson palace, I will govern day and night. Create a city of spawn who bow before me, cast a fog over the world for my children.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: I wish we could retreat into our palace already, and spend a decade in each other's arms.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: But first we must manage the trifling matter of the brain. Perhaps it will listen to us. Perhaps it, too, will serve.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Isn't it enough to have each other?

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: Love, look at what's in front of your very eyes. We could have everything.

147.speaker: Astarion
147.text: Baldur's Gate is a city of opportunity like no other, and I don't intend to let one like this pass us by.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I just want my city back.

190.speaker: Astarion
190.text: Of course, so do I. Luxury, sin, all the Baldurian comforts I'm finally free to enjoy.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: If the Chosen could subdue it, so can we. We'll rule together.

212.speaker: Astarion
212.text: I'm so lucky I crash-landed next to such an intelligent creature as you. We make a fine team, don't we?

127.speaker: Astarion
127.text: Precisely. I'm not ashamed, dear. I won. We won.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Was killing Cazador not enough? You already want more?

219.speaker: Astarion
219.text: Vengeance has been reaped upon Cazador, but not the world that made him. Not the world that makes people like him.

157.speaker: Astarion
157.text: Shut up. You don't know what it was like. You never will.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: If you're sure that's what you want, I'll fight with you.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: All those deaths, and you don't even know what they've paid for.

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: Death was better for them. Death is better for many. I will stand by it.

136.speaker: Astarion
136.text: Mephistopheles has made a new monster, not bound a creature to his will. The Rite was honoured, the sacrifice is over.

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: As you live with his gift, for better or worse, now so do I.

142.speaker: Astarion
142.text: Just so you know, I have everything I ever wanted.
142.context: InternalNodeContext: The player broke up with Lord Astarion. Possible for both Karlach and non-Karlach players. For Karlach - only if she broke up with him without him trying to convert her (we have a separate branch for that). Not a releationship dialog, available till discussed.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: But the palace's halls will be lonely.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: Very soon I will discover how to call my legions of wolves, become a sea of mist, run wrongside-up on roofs. Everything vampires do best.

99.speaker: Astarion
99.text: You could have, too. What a waste.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Do you mean the ritual didn't give you the powers you hoped for?

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: The language of the night needs learning. All in due time. It won't be long, hear me. It won't be long.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: You don't really have anything at all.

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: I can take anything I want. I should have made you a spawn just to teach you that.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I thought you were perfect when we first met. What a waste you became this.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: I - I was pathetic then. What do you mean? Why would you say that?

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: You will regret leaving me. More than anything you live to regret.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: And you just wanted me as a piece of furniture.

234.speaker: Astarion
234.text: You refused riches beyond belief. The world would have knelt before us united.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: What is happening to you? The ritual has changed you so much.

123.speaker: Astarion
123.text: So much for the better. My instincts are already so quick, the world seems slow around me.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: There's nothing of the man I loved left in you.

230.speaker: Astarion
230.text: I have turned away my former self. And all my former attachments, now, too.

165.speaker: Astarion
165.context: InternalNodeContext: Astarion just killed Cazador and stayed Vampire Spawn. Immediate follow up in the Ritual Room with IPRD.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: After all these years - these centuries - it's really over.

80.speaker: Astarion
80.text: I'm not sure. I feel a little numb.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: What I've lost, what I've gained - it's all so much.

104.speaker: Astarion
104.text: And gods, all those spawn, free in the Underdark.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: I need some time, I think. Just to let it all sink in.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: Let's just go. This place reeks of death and I want to feel alive again.

119.speaker: Astarion
119.text: And gods, all those spawn, dead in their cells.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'm proud of you. You did the right thing.

189.speaker: Astarion
189.text: I'm glad you think so, because I'm not so sure. I just feel numb.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: You don't regret giving up all that power?

188.speaker: Astarion
188.text: No. Well... maybe a little, but I'm not sure.

192.speaker: Astarion
192.text: It's strange, knowing I'll never hear Cazador's voice again. Knowing it'll never command me to bow against my will.
192.context: InternalNodeContext: We discuss Astarion staying a spawn. Non-romance option. Morning CRD, available the next morning after Astarion deciding to stay a spawn.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: Invigorating? Terrifying? All of the above? I'm still trying to understand it, really.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: I came so close to losing everything back there. To losing myself.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Do you regret turning down all that power?

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Perhaps. It would have been terrible fun.

226.speaker: Astarion
226.text: But then again, I could feel something slipping away. I came so close to losing myself - losing everything I'd learned since meeting you.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: In that ritual chamber, you were someone else. Someone unrecognisable.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: You're not wrong. Cazador left his mark on me in more ways than one - for a moment, I wanted to be just like him.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'm sorry we couldn't save the other vampire spawn.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: We could have tried. We could have given them the same chance I had.

182.speaker: Astarion
182.text: I was able to go out into the world and make better choices. To go against my nature and become more than a blood-sucking monster. Maybe they would have done the same.

233.speaker: Astarion
233.text: Or maybe not - but did we have the right to take that choice away from them?

24.speaker: Player
24.text: They would've killed thousands of innocent people. You know they would.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: Probably, yes. Destroying them wasn't a good solution, but maybe it was the least bad.

149.speaker: Astarion
149.text: I suppose that's the less convenient side of freedom - having to live with the choices you made.

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: Back at the ritual, all I could see was the power on offer and the safety it promised. I was so blinded by it. Just as Cazador was.

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: But you saw something in me - someone else I could be. Someone who could break the cycle of power and terror that started centuries ago.

194.speaker: Astarion
194.text: You saved me back there. I may not have appreciated it at the time, but I do now. Thank you.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: You saved yourself, I just gave you a push.

158.speaker: Astarion
158.text: You did more than that. You believed in me - believed I was enough just the way I am.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: When I look at my future, anything and everything feels possible now.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: And nice as it would have been to share this with a partner, I'm glad I get to share it with a friend.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: You saved me from myself and let me walk a new path where I can be free. Truly, honestly free.

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: This is a gift, you know. Thank you - I won't forget it.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: And I get to share it with you, as a partner. An equal.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: The ritual would have changed you. I'm glad you resisted it.

202.speaker: Astarion
202.text: So am I. Fun as all that power would have been... this feels more 'me'.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I wasn't sure if you'd stop the ritual or not, honestly.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: Neither was I. Not until I sank the dagger into Cazador's chest and the light went out of his eyes.

181.speaker: Astarion
181.text: I am - well, not 'happy' with how things turned out. But this does feel right.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: I'm sorry we couldn't save the other vampire spawn.

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: We could have tried. We could have given them the same chance I was given.

237.speaker: Astarion
237.text: Then again, how many lives would that have cost? Even in the Underdark, they would have been dangerous.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: I don't know, maybe there just weren't any good options. I only hope we picked the least bad one.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: I'm just glad this worked out for you.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: What's done is done - it can't be changed now.

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: No, it can't. And I can't say I'm unhappy about it either.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I was more worried about you. I didn't know if you'd stop the ritual.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Do you think we did the right thing, freeing all those vampire spawn?

128.speaker: Astarion
128.text: I only hope my siblings are up to the challenge. The Underdark is not a forgiving place.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: No, but it's the call we made. We need to live with that.

231.speaker: Astarion
231.text: You could have said the same about me when we first met. People can change. But perhaps you're right.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Do you think we did the right thing, freeing all those vampire spawn?

164.speaker: Astarion
164.text: I have to hope so. And if not, at least there's only so much damage they can do in the Underdark.

228.speaker: Astarion
228.text: But that first rush of freedom can be intoxicating - I didn't always make the best decisions when I first tasted it. They'll need guidance.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: Are you volunteering for the job?

139.speaker: Astarion
139.text: No, much as I'd like to become a lord ruling over the Underdark's vampire spawn, we have unfinished business with the mind flayers.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: After that - who knows? Everything that happened to those spawn is my fault in a way...

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Do you think your brothers and sisters can do it?

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: I hope so, because there'll be consequences if they can't. The Underdark is not a forgiving place.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I just hope they don't kill anyone.

203.speaker: Astarion
203.text: They... might? But there'll be consequences if they do - the Underdark is not a forgiving place.

220.speaker: Astarion
220.text: And what makes you think I have anything to say to you?
220.context: InternalNodeContext: Lord Astarion failed to convert Karlach into a spawn during the Black Mass Aftermath romance night. Not a relationship dialog, available till discussed.

207.speaker: Astarion
207.text: I tried to give you a gift and you rejected me. Not just you - your whole body!

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I didn't reject you. You're being totally unfair.

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: Oh when has the world ever given a damn about 'fair'?

173.speaker: Astarion
173.text: I thought you were better than this, you know. That you might make a worthy consort. But I was wrong.

191.speaker: Astarion
191.text: We'll see this mind flayer business through, but once that's done, we're done.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Go fuck yourself, you absolute prick.

146.speaker: Astarion
146.text: There she is - there's the gutsy devil I fell for.

120.speaker: Astarion
120.text: How disappointing that this is what's become of her.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: You're so different from the person I thought I loved.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: No, I'm better than he ever was.

118.speaker: Astarion
118.text: I've marched forward into my beautiful new future. It's a pity you couldn't keep up.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You said you could handle it. I believed you.

195.speaker: Astarion
195.text: I handled it perfectly! It's you and your damn engine that ruined it.

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Why are you so angry? I... I love you, Astarion - stop this.

209.speaker: Astarion
209.text: That's all you have to say? After everything I've done for you.
